title: What does being uninspired, bored, and disinterested in life imply about me? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a number of un-evolved answers here. How about this… Life isn’t actually all that interesting? Eat, sleep, shit, shower, shave, work, pay bills, and entertain yourself in between. Maybe if you have some money you can buy something ‘exciting’. But in general, life is not really an ‘adventure’. We’re just here. No one ‘succeeds’. Even the richest people in the world will (and have) died. Everyone goes through a lot of different experiences no matter how ‘good’ you think they have it. Friends will come and friends will go. But they are all just ‘people’: flawed, eating, sleeping, shitting, showering, shaving, working, paying bills, and entertaining themselves in between. The new Star Wars movie will be over after two hours and 21 minutes. The next season of Game of Thrones isn’t going to be too different from the first 6. Every football game is the same. Going on a killing spree is generally illegal. So we have fairly mundane existences to contend with while we struggle to maintain them until we die. This doesn’t mean you can’t enjoy your life. It doesn’t exactly mean you are depressed to not be all that interested. It means you probably get it and don’t need drama. For the most part we are all just fish in a giant tank, waiting for the roof to open up, and for someone to throw flakes down on us that we can suck from the surface and poop out later. Sometimes, no one comes to throw flakes. We are swimming with our own poop and the water is filthy and the other fish just won’t let us chill. Go for a walk.
